com.nutiteq.rasterlayers
Class PackagedMapLayer

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.layers.Layer
      com.nutiteq.rasterlayers.RasterLayer
          com.nutiteq.rasterlayers.PackagedMapLayer

public class PackagedMapLayer
extends RasterLayer

A raster layer class that uses the map bundled in the /res/raw/ folder as a source. The request are generate in this manner:

"/res/raw/" + name + zoom + "_" + x + "_" + y

For example if: name = "t"

"/res/raw/" + "t" + "0" + "_" + "0" + "_" + "0"

Result: /res/raw/t0_0_0

Constructor Detail

PackagedMapLayer

public PackagedMapLayer(Projection projection,
                        int minZoom,
                        int maxZoom,
                        int id,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        android.content.Context context)
Class constructor. Creates a new raster layer that uses the res/raw/ folder as a source for the tile data. Tiles that are out of the specified minimum / maximum zoom range are not downloaded. The id used should be unique to each raster layer, if two or more raster layers use the same id, they will also share the tiles in the cache. Supported image formats are .jpg and .png, the image type is determined automatically.

Parameters:
projection - the desired projection
minZoom - the minimum zoom
maxZoom - the maximum zoom
id - the user generated id for this raster layer
name - the prefix for the file name
context - the activity or appliaction context
Method Detail

fetchTile

public void fetchTile(TileQuadTreeNode tile)
Description copied from class: RasterLayer
Start appropriate task for fetching the requested tile. This gets called when a visible tile can't be found in any of the caches and thus must be reloaded from the source. Inheriting classes can either start a new task immediately or wait for the flush command to start all at once. NB! You need to start the task in your implementation, it is not done automatically. If you have online tiles then usually you calculate your URL (urlString) and the following line is the last one in your implementation: components.rasterTaskPool.execute(new NetFetchTileTask(tile, components, tileIdOffset, urlString));

Specified by:
fetchTile in class RasterLayer
Parameters:
tile - the requested tile

flush

public void flush()
Description copied from class: RasterLayer
Flushes the currently pending tiles list. Gets called every time the screen changes and all the tiles that have to be fetched have been determined. Implementing this is not required, if the fetchTile method starts the appropriate tasks itself.

Specified by:
flush in class RasterLayer
